N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 387.23 - Food stamp employment and training program plans

State Regulations
(a) Funding. The commissioner will distribute
to social services districts all or a portion of those Federal funds
appropriated to New York State by the United States Department of Agriculture
for the purpose of implementing approved food stamp employment and training
plans. The methodology for distribution of such funds, as developed by the
commissioner, shall consider the total number of food stamp work registrants
within each local district, the amount of funds previously expended by the
social services districts for food stamp employment and training programs, and/or other factors as deemed appropriate by the commissioner. (b) Records and reports. In order to prepare
adequate notification and plans as required by section
387.10
of this Title, each social
services district must: (1)
maintain an
inventory of food stamp recipients specifying the current work registrant
status and the status as able bodied adults without dependents (ABAWD) of such
recipients in accordance with the criteria contained in section
387.3
of this Title; and
(2)
maintain records and provide information
and data regarding the food stamp caseload, and individual recipients of such
benefits to the Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance, as required by
the commissioner. Notes
